history.content:
I've taken 186 and 126. Both of them are really good courses, but it depends on what the rest of your schedule looks like and what you want to focus on. If you're looking to go down the AI/ML route, take EECS 126, especially if you want to take 189 later on (it helps with that because it builds your probability intuition). It's a really demanding course, however, and will require a lot of commitment; for me, personally, it took much more time than 170 did, even though I didn't take them together.

If you want something that's either a little lighter in workload or more closely related to industry level software engineering, take CS 186.

children.subject:
mm, that's tougher. A recurrent theme and focal point of 186 is reducing I/Os, and so you'll want to understand cache policies, which are taught in great detail in 61C. It is taught in 186 as well, and I know people that have taken 186 before 61C and still done well, but I also know people that struggled in 186 in part due to the holes from not having taken 61C.

It's up to you, but if you feel like you're a good programmer and did fine in 61B, then you should be able to adapt on the fly. If you struggled with 61B, I'd recommend taking 61C instead of 186.

I took 186 and 61C concurrently. At least during my semester (fall 2016), the 61C topics covered in 186 were essentially re-taught. However, it was more of a review as opposed to a comprehensive overview of the topics so it did take a bit of effort on my part to fill in the holes. If you're willing to put in a couple more hours throughout the semester to learn the 61C stuff then you should be fine.
would it be fine to take it without 61c?

186 is good if you were very comfortable with 61B. I’d honestly say that math 110 or CS 168 would be a good bet too (if you can get in to 168). Short of that, try CS 176, which I’ve heard is fairly light. I dunno many others lightish classes that you’d be interested in, but maybe other people have ideas?

Thanks for your reply. i actually have a lot of commitments next semester, so i'm looking for a course that would be slightly less time consuming because I want to learn 170 well? Any suggestions? thanks

history.content:
Hi,

Based on the professors this fall, which CS/EE courses would you guys recommend with CS 170?

Other classes I wanted to take: EE126/127, CS186, and open to suggestions. I can't take 188 because of time conflicts.

I also need to do 61C, but I've heard that 170 + 61C is very tough. 

[I have taken CS 61A, CS61B, CS70, Math 54, Math 53]

thank you!
history.subject: CS Course to take with 170
